result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James T Moody in court.  Attorney Thomas Harris appeared by video for James T Moody. Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Status Of Counsel. Defense Counsel confirmed appointment to the case and requests a Preliminary Hearing date. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-19-2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-19-2022
Received and Filed. OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT

Defendant James T Moody in court in person.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Case adjourned due to SPD failing to appoint counsel. State requests that the matter be set for a Lee Hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Received and Filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Court ordered no contact with co-def:  Keon Hicks, Jakwan H., 1319 West North Avenue, 24/7 Gas Station
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Court ordered co-defs kept separate while in custody.

Defendant James T Moody in court with attorney David Thomas Conley.  Defendant James T Moody in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James T Moody appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
